GOD.content: secrecy essential to sacrificial responsibility, absolute, infinite, duty in name of God as tout autre, who must remain transcendent, hidden, secret, jealous of love, commands he gives
GOD.linkedContent: secrecy essential to sacrificial responsibility, absolute, infinite, duty in name of God as tout autre, who must remain transcendent, hidden, secret, jealous of love, commands he gives

GOD.content: absolute duty denounces all duties, responsibilities of human law [i.e. general ethics]

formula tout autre est tout autre disturbs while reinforcing Kierkegaard’s discourse, it means that Abraham’s God is found everywhere something is wholly other; and since each of us is infinitely other in absolute singularity [Abraham’s election is universalized?]
GOD.linkedContent: formula tout autre est tout autre disturbs while reinforcing Kierkegaard’s discourse, it means that Abraham’s God is found everywhere something is wholly other; and since each of us is infinitely other in absolute singularity [Abraham’s election is universalized?]

GOD.content: [we are all Abraham in every instant] responsibility and relation of gift of death of each instant
GOD.linkedContent: [we are all Abraham in every instant] responsibility and relation of gift of death of each instant

GOD.content: via tout autre est tout autre & Kierkegaard, supplementary complication upon ethical generality: everyone else asks at every moment to behave as knights of faith
GOD.linkedContent: via tout autre est tout autre & Kierkegaard, supplementary complication upon ethical generality: everyone else asks at every moment to behave as knights of faith

GOD.content: Derrida introduces tout autre est tout autre, then compares it to the speculative which requires a heterotautological position (Hegel, revealed religion that is precisely Christian) [G], always risks meaning nothing, speculates on every secret
GOD.linkedContent: Derrida introduces tout autre est tout autre, then compares it to the speculative which requires a heterotautological position (Hegel, revealed religion that is precisely Christian) [G], always risks meaning nothing, speculates on every secret

GOD.content: “let us not play at turning this little sentence around in order to make it dazzle from every angle” [instead Derrida interested in the incompatible duplicity of meaning]
GOD.linkedContent: “let us not play at turning this little sentence around in order to make it dazzle from every angle” [instead Derrida interested in the incompatible duplicity of meaning]

GOD.content: sacrifice: price to pay for not injuring tout autre, violence of sacrifice in name of non-violence; w/ Kant, self-sacrifice sacrifices most proper in service of most proper
GOD.linkedContent: sacrifice: price to pay for not injuring tout autre, violence of sacrifice in name of non-violence; w/ Kant, self-sacrifice sacrifices most proper in service of most proper

GOD.content: secret of secrecy: we have no knowledge of it, and it is there for no one (et qu’il n’est là pour personne), a secret doesn’t belong, never at home or in its place (chez soi)
GOD.linkedContent: secret of secrecy: we have no knowledge of it, and it is there for no one (et qu’il n’est là pour personne), a secret doesn’t belong, never at home or in its place (chez soi)

GOD.content: what’s the sense of saying “my” secret, if the secret can only be revealed au tout autre
GOD.linkedContent: what’s the sense of saying “my” secret, if the secret can only be revealed au tout autre

GT.content: [re: 2 characters in “Counterfeit Money”] espacement: ils s’éloignent du même pas, mais d’un pas qui aussi doit être tout autre
GT.linkedContent: [re: 2 characters in “Counterfeit Money”] espacement: ils s’éloignent du même pas, mais d’un pas qui aussi doit être tout autre

MONL.content: madness of a hypermnesia, a supplement of loyalty, commit to traces of writing: toward an anamnesis of the entirely other > this is the most difficult thing [Aristotle says same about virtue]
MONL.linkedContent: madness of a hypermnesia, a supplement of loyalty, commit to traces of writing: toward an anamnesis of the entirely other > this is the most difficult thing [Aristotle says same about virtue]

MONL.content: entirely other prior-to-the-first language, zone outside law, degree zero-minus-one of writing, leaves a phantomatical map
MONL.linkedContent: entirely other prior-to-the-first language, zone outside law, degree zero-minus-one of writing, leaves a phantomatical map

MONL.content: other is entirely other when knowledge and recognition does not suffice for it
MONL.linkedContent: other is entirely other when knowledge and recognition does not suffice for it

R.content: pure ethics, if there is any, begins w/ respectable dignity of the other, absolutely unlike (neighbor, resemblance, ruins such an ethics)
R.linkedContent: pure ethics, if there is any, begins w/ respectable dignity of the other, absolutely unlike (neighbor, resemblance, ruins such an ethics)

FK.content: socius as the secret of testimonial experience, a certain faith, address/relation to tout autre, that is, socius as non-relationship of absolute interruption: Levinas, Blanchot
FK.linkedContent: socius as the secret of testimonial experience, a certain faith, address/relation to tout autre, that is, socius as non-relationship of absolute interruption: Levinas, Blanchot

H.content: foreigner vs. barbarian (absolutely other does not have a name or family name)
H.linkedContent: foreigner vs. barbarian (absolutely other does not have a name or family name)

AF.content: Derrida trembles when Yerushalmi declares “only in Israel” [is there future, is there past], logic of election, question of proper name, exemplarity > place of all violences
AF.linkedContent: Derrida trembles when Yerushalmi declares “only in Israel” [is there future, is there past], logic of election, question of proper name, exemplarity > place of all violences

AF.content: if it is just to remember to guard and gather archive, it’s just as just to remember the others, tout autre est tout autre [invaginates]
AF.linkedContent: if it is just to remember to guard and gather archive, it’s just as just to remember the others, tout autre est tout autre [invaginates]

SPOM.content: question of the event as question of the ghost: first time (but also last time) & repetition, tout autre > hauntology, logic of haunting: more powerful than ontology, harbors eschatology/teleology as effects, mise en scène pour une fin de l’histoire
SPOM.linkedContent: question of the event as question of the ghost: first time (but also last time) & repetition, tout autre > hauntology, logic of haunting: more powerful than ontology, harbors eschatology/teleology as effects, mise en scène pour une fin de l’histoire

SPOM.content: “absolute proximity of a stranger whose power is singular and anonymous (es spukt),” unnameable, neutral power > this, which we have said nothing determinable urgently returns, insists, gives one to think, irresistible anguish, like that of future and death, doesn’t stem from but produces automatism of repetition alongside principle of reason > tout autre est tout autre ——nous faisant régulièrement parler depuis le lieu où nous ne voulons rien dire, où nous savons clairement ce que nous ne voulons pas dire mais ne savons pas ce que nous voudrions dire, comme si cela n'était plus ni de l'ordre du savoir ni de l'ordre du vouloir ou du vouloir-dire
SPOM.linkedContent: “absolute proximity of a stranger whose power is singular and anonymous (es spukt),” unnameable, neutral power > this, which we have said nothing determinable urgently returns, insists, gives one to think, irresistible anguish, like that of future and death, doesn’t stem from but produces automatism of repetition alongside principle of reason > tout autre est tout autre ——nous faisant régulièrement parler depuis le lieu où nous ne voulons rien dire, où nous savons clairement ce que nous ne voulons pas dire mais ne savons pas ce que nous voudrions dire, comme si cela n'était plus ni de l'ordre du savoir ni de l'ordre du vouloir ou du vouloir-dire

POOF.content: wound opens w/ necessity to count one’s friends, democracy’s 2 irreducible laws: 1) respect for irreducible singularity or alterity 2) calculation of majorities, representable subjects, all equal
POOF.linkedContent: wound opens w/ necessity to count one’s friends, democracy’s 2 irreducible laws: 1) respect for irreducible singularity or alterity 2) calculation of majorities, representable subjects, all equal

POOF.content: mais là où tout autre est également tout autre > political desire borne by this disjunction, bears chance of future of democracy, divided virtue, inadequate to itself, chaos opening in silence
POOF.linkedContent: mais là où tout autre est également tout autre > political desire borne by this disjunction, bears chance of future of democracy, divided virtue, inadequate to itself, chaos opening in silence

POOF.content: no virtue, w/out the tragedy of # w/out #, perhaps more unthinkable than tragedy
POOF.linkedContent: no virtue, w/out the tragedy of # w/out #, perhaps more unthinkable than tragedy

POOF.content: philosophers of the future will be at once its [the fundamentally other] figure & responsibility
POOF.linkedContent: philosophers of the future will be at once its [the fundamentally other] figure & responsibility

POOF.content: double infinite responsibility: “an intertwining of temporal ekstases; a friendship to come of time w/ itself where we meet again the interlacing of the same and the tout autre (‘Grundlich-Anderes’)”
POOF.linkedContent: double infinite responsibility: “an intertwining of temporal ekstases; a friendship to come of time w/ itself where we meet again the interlacing of the same and the tout autre (‘Grundlich-Anderes’)”

POOF.content: caught up in a responsibility w/out freedom, silent deployment of strange violence at origin of justice/friendship, dissymmetrical curving of social space, perhaps the essence of the law [law before law] when one countersigns an affirmation ‘speaking in one’s own name’ > ineluctably responsible the moment we signify, freedom assigned to us from the other > tout autre est tout autre overflows (succeeds, survives) autonomy (where law one gives oneself & name one receives conspire)
POOF.linkedContent: caught up in a responsibility w/out freedom, silent deployment of strange violence at origin of justice/friendship, dissymmetrical curving of social space, perhaps the essence of the law [law before law] when one countersigns an affirmation ‘speaking in one’s own name’ > ineluctably responsible the moment we signify, freedom assigned to us from the other > tout autre est tout autre overflows (succeeds, survives) autonomy (where law one gives oneself & name one receives conspire)

HASD.content: khora, neither an event nor a giving, neither an order nor a promise, the wholly other (tout autre), neither transcendent, absolutely distanced, nor immanent and close
HASD.linkedContent: khora, neither an event nor a giving, neither an order nor a promise, the wholly other (tout autre), neither transcendent, absolutely distanced, nor immanent and close

HASD.content: God is the Good that transcends the Good, the Being that transcends Being, this “logic” is that of the “without (sans)” > transcendence nothing other, and tout autre, than what it transcends
HASD.linkedContent: God is the Good that transcends the Good, the Being that transcends Being, this “logic” is that of the “without (sans)” > transcendence nothing other, and tout autre, than what it transcends

HASD.content: strangeness of what is as le tout autre (das schlechthin Andere)—transcendence, which, acc. Heidegger, Plato properly expresses w/ epekeina tes ousias
HASD.linkedContent: strangeness of what is as le tout autre (das schlechthin Andere)—transcendence, which, acc. Heidegger, Plato properly expresses w/ epekeina tes ousias

MPM.content: there is no beyond-the-undecidable, remains to be thought, incalculable order of tout autre, there is no inside-the-undecidable, but an other (singular) memory calls us w/out leading us back to any anteriority > there never existed an older, more original “third term”
MPM.linkedContent: there is no beyond-the-undecidable, remains to be thought, incalculable order of tout autre, there is no inside-the-undecidable, but an other (singular) memory calls us w/out leading us back to any anteriority > there never existed an older, more original “third term”

A.content: decision concerns choice btwn relation w/ a wholly non-opposable other (an other that’s not its other) and an other who is its other (can be opposed in a couple) > the former relation is that of aporia, not a crossing of border but a double concept of the border
A.linkedContent: decision concerns choice btwn relation w/ a wholly non-opposable other (an other that’s not its other) and an other who is its other (can be opposed in a couple) > the former relation is that of aporia, not a crossing of border but a double concept of the border

A.content: if death names irreplaceability of absolute singularity (no one can die in my place or in place of the other) then all examples in world can illustrate this singularity, death of all those who say “my death” is irreplaceable [universal?] > tout autre est tout autre
A.linkedContent: if death names irreplaceability of absolute singularity (no one can die in my place or in place of the other) then all examples in world can illustrate this singularity, death of all those who say “my death” is irreplaceable [universal?] > tout autre est tout autre

A.content: triple transitivity of s’attendre: 1) oneself 2) arrivant, the other 3) await each other, which is immediately consonant w/ reference to tout autre [cf. HST p. 360]
A.linkedContent: triple transitivity of s’attendre: 1) oneself 2) arrivant, the other 3) await each other, which is immediately consonant w/ reference to tout autre [cf. HST p. 360]

EM.content: interest in universality of anthropos a sign of West’s attempt to interiorize, master what’s different from it, l’effet de cette différence d’un tout autre ordre, where philosophical colloquium has no meaning, this other space neither barren, nor desert-like
EM.linkedContent: interest in universality of anthropos a sign of West’s attempt to interiorize, master what’s different from it, l’effet de cette différence d’un tout autre ordre, where philosophical colloquium has no meaning, this other space neither barren, nor desert-like

VM.content: for Levinas, w/out the irruption of tout-autre, internal consciousness could not se donner le temps nor [give itself] the absolute alterity of every instant
VM.linkedContent: for Levinas, w/out the irruption of tout-autre, internal consciousness could not se donner le temps nor [give itself] the absolute alterity of every instant

VM.content: acc. Levinas, concepts anticipate a horizon w/in which alterity is amortized as soon as it is announced—because foreseen, horizon always horizon of the same
VM.linkedContent: acc. Levinas, concepts anticipate a horizon w/in which alterity is amortized as soon as it is announced—because foreseen, horizon always horizon of the same

VM.content: for Levinas, infinitely-other cannot be thought on basis of the same
VM.linkedContent: for Levinas, infinitely-other cannot be thought on basis of the same

VM.content: Levinas’ infinitism is pre-Kantian, Levinas’ reading of Descartes’ 3rd Meditation supports entirety of his thought: absolute irreducibility of other, infinitely Other can only be infinity
VM.linkedContent: Levinas’ infinitism is pre-Kantian, Levinas’ reading of Descartes’ 3rd Meditation supports entirety of his thought: absolute irreducibility of other, infinitely Other can only be infinity

VM.content: Kierkegaard had a sense of relationship w/ irreducibility of tout-autre by way of Abraham
VM.linkedContent: Kierkegaard had a sense of relationship w/ irreducibility of tout-autre by way of Abraham

VM.content: think Levinas’ infinitely-other, to think unthinkable-impossible-unutterable beyond (tradition’s) Being and Logos ——infinitely other not as a positive infinite, as God; acc. Levinas, can’t designate infinitely other via negation of (finite) spatial exteriority, must renounce all negativity, labor, thus language, thus first of all words “infinite,” “other”
VM.linkedContent: think Levinas’ infinitely-other, to think unthinkable-impossible-unutterable beyond (tradition’s) Being and Logos ——infinitely other not as a positive infinite, as God; acc. Levinas, can’t designate infinitely other via negation of (finite) spatial exteriority, must renounce all negativity, labor, thus language, thus first of all words “infinite,” “other”

VM.content: infinitely other & infinitely same, if they have meaning for a finite being, is the same
VM.linkedContent: infinitely other & infinitely same, if they have meaning for a finite being, is the same

VM.content: for Levinas, origin of concept must be the gift of the world to the other as tout autre, not the thought of Being
VM.linkedContent: for Levinas, origin of concept must be the gift of the world to the other as tout autre, not the thought of Being

VM.content: empiricism, true name of renunciation of the concept [what Levinas risks], the dream of a purely heterological thought, pure thought of pure difference, metaphysical pretension or modesty? [thought of God: empiricism?] > empiricism as dream, vanishes as soon as language awakens > but language is sleeping? doubtless [empiricism as anti-philosophy?]
VM.linkedContent: empiricism, true name of renunciation of the concept [what Levinas risks], the dream of a purely heterological thought, pure thought of pure difference, metaphysical pretension or modesty? [thought of God: empiricism?] > empiricism as dream, vanishes as soon as language awakens > but language is sleeping? doubtless [empiricism as anti-philosophy?]

VM.content: nothing can so profoundly solicit Greek logos as irruption of tout-autre > Greek language offers hospitality to a thought which remains foreign to it [Jew/Christian in his home]
VM.linkedContent: nothing can so profoundly solicit Greek logos as irruption of tout-autre > Greek language offers hospitality to a thought which remains foreign to it [Jew/Christian in his home]

VM.content: worst violence (what some call Judaic experience of infinitely other), when one silently delivers oneself into hands of other in the night
VM.linkedContent: worst violence (what some call Judaic experience of infinitely other), when one silently delivers oneself into hands of other in the night

OH.content: must be suspicious of repetitive memory and tout autre of absolutely new [cf. POOF p. 65], of anamnestic capitalization & amnesic exposure to what would no longer be identifiable
OH.linkedContent: must be suspicious of repetitive memory and tout autre of absolutely new [cf. POOF p. 65], of anamnestic capitalization & amnesic exposure to what would no longer be identifiable

PAS.content: to think “starting from (à partir de)” Blanchot departs from the reassuring line of thought of philosophy, thinks tout autre; inappropriate inclusion of tout autre in the same
PAS.linkedContent: to think “starting from (à partir de)” Blanchot departs from the reassuring line of thought of philosophy, thinks tout autre; inappropriate inclusion of tout autre in the same

PAS.content: each pas transgresses the pas [contamination of adverb/noun]; violence of this dislocation, sur une scène tout autre, occurs, increases, when it appears not to displace anything in discursivity, consciousness, in unscathed, assured normality of language [alters subterraneanly]
PAS.linkedContent: each pas transgresses the pas [contamination of adverb/noun]; violence of this dislocation, sur une scène tout autre, occurs, increases, when it appears not to displace anything in discursivity, consciousness, in unscathed, assured normality of language [alters subterraneanly]

PAS.content: science is a dissimulation of tout autre, philosophy also > Blanchot keeps “old name” to attempt to give an account of this
PAS.linkedContent: science is a dissimulation of tout autre, philosophy also > Blanchot keeps “old name” to attempt to give an account of this

PAS.content: [list of Blanchot’s many sans constructions] X sans X forms the trace or the pas of the toute autre that acts on itself there (s’y agit) > degree o (eau); il reste un reste sans reste de ce passage (il y a —pas—rien, un texte, un récit, déjà)
PAS.linkedContent: [list of Blanchot’s many sans constructions] X sans X forms the trace or the pas of the toute autre that acts on itself there (s’y agit) > degree o (eau); il reste un reste sans reste de ce passage (il y a —pas—rien, un texte, un récit, déjà)

PAS.content: formulation of sans is impossible; sheltered (abrité) by paleonym w/out relation to it, invests paleonym w/ tout autre > sans—trace de pas
PAS.linkedContent: formulation of sans is impossible; sheltered (abrité) by paleonym w/out relation to it, invests paleonym w/ tout autre > sans—trace de pas

PAS.content: sans is infinitely passive to tout autre that approaches it, sans auto-affects itself by tout autre
PAS.linkedContent: sans is infinitely passive to tout autre that approaches it, sans auto-affects itself by tout autre

S.content: performing as Heidegger, Derrida affirms [?] Heidegger’s rigorous repetition [not hollow], which crosses path of tout autre [re: attempt to move beyond Christianity]
S.linkedContent: performing as Heidegger, Derrida affirms [?] Heidegger’s rigorous repetition [not hollow], which crosses path of tout autre [re: attempt to move beyond Christianity]

T.content: luxating philosophical ear, set loxōs in logos to work, une tout autre forme d’embuscade, lokhos, block correspondence muffling other hammer [speaks to him w/ third ear]
T.linkedContent: luxating philosophical ear, set loxōs in logos to work, une tout autre forme d’embuscade, lokhos, block correspondence muffling other hammer [speaks to him w/ third ear]

SH.content: tout autre in Celan, ganz Anderen Sache, other does not contradict, enters into alliance w/, in expropriating, “inmost concern”
SH.linkedContent: tout autre in Celan, ganz Anderen Sache, other does not contradict, enters into alliance w/, in expropriating, “inmost concern”

SH.content: privilege of code (clock, calendar) [in Celan], that which allows one to call off the hours, to class (calare) > calendar, clock, name return of tout autre in the same > hour writes, speaks
SH.linkedContent: privilege of code (clock, calendar) [in Celan], that which allows one to call off the hours, to class (calare) > calendar, clock, name return of tout autre in the same > hour writes, speaks

FWT.content: differance is at once: the same (living being, but deferred, supplemented by technology, prosthesis) and the other (absolutely heterogenous, wholly other, death, irreducible, untranslatable); ——differance can both interrupt laws and introduce economy of new configuration into living being, it can both be reinscribed in economy of the same and opened to excess of tout autre
FWT.linkedContent: differance is at once: the same (living being, but deferred, supplemented by technology, prosthesis) and the other (absolutely heterogenous, wholly other, death, irreducible, untranslatable); ——differance can both interrupt laws and introduce economy of new configuration into living being, it can both be reinscribed in economy of the same and opened to excess of tout autre

FWT.content: against Adorno’s “no poetry” > instead, a call for writing, just thought: to be faithful to an other one cannot internalize, categorize, justice to be invented; “a voice of sheer silence,” [Laporte, Une voix de fin silence] enjoins us to begin again tout autre
FWT.linkedContent: against Adorno’s “no poetry” > instead, a call for writing, just thought: to be faithful to an other one cannot internalize, categorize, justice to be invented; “a voice of sheer silence,” [Laporte, Une voix de fin silence] enjoins us to begin again tout autre

FWT.content: how to guard, watch over, what can’t be watched over, internalized > paradox of fidelity to tout autre > watch over tout autre w/out tout autre dissolving/identifying w/ same in the same
FWT.linkedContent: how to guard, watch over, what can’t be watched over, internalized > paradox of fidelity to tout autre > watch over tout autre w/out tout autre dissolving/identifying w/ same in the same

DS.content: closure of metaphysics: not as a border enclosing homogenous space but acc. noncircular, tout autre, figure (invariable reference to primary truth, reference itself)
DS.linkedContent: closure of metaphysics: not as a border enclosing homogenous space but acc. noncircular, tout autre, figure (invariable reference to primary truth, reference itself)

OS.content: Heidegger designates milieu of self-evidence, outside which thought suffocates > has not entire philosophy been authorized on “extraordinary right” of present? for Heidegger, it’s not a question of thinking otherwise, it’s thinking that which could not have been, nor thought, otherwise ——the impossibility of the otherwise produces a trembling, a question of tout autre, think the tie btwn truth/presence, in a thought that doesn’t need to be true/present [no skeptical moment]
OS.linkedContent: Heidegger designates milieu of self-evidence, outside which thought suffocates > has not entire philosophy been authorized on “extraordinary right” of present? for Heidegger, it’s not a question of thinking otherwise, it’s thinking that which could not have been, nor thought, otherwise ——the impossibility of the otherwise produces a trembling, a question of tout autre, think the tie btwn truth/presence, in a thought that doesn’t need to be true/present [no skeptical moment]

P.content: “grosse Schwierigkeit” of critical judgment of beauty [un plaisir désintéressé], auto-affection must cathect w/ pure objectivity, universality w/out concept, pure pleasure w/out enjoyment > Wohlgefallen (I-please-myself-in), Je-me-plais-à-me-plaire-à > auto-affection immediately goes outside: is pure hetero-affection, tout autre cathects me, w/out which, there’d be no universality
P.linkedContent: “grosse Schwierigkeit” of critical judgment of beauty [un plaisir désintéressé], auto-affection must cathect w/ pure objectivity, universality w/out concept, pure pleasure w/out enjoyment > Wohlgefallen (I-please-myself-in), Je-me-plais-à-me-plaire-à > auto-affection immediately goes outside: is pure hetero-affection, tout autre cathects me, w/out which, there’d be no universality

ATIA.content: animal as tout autre, tout autre est tout autre, unreadable, undecidable, abyssal, secret > what happens to brotherhood when animal comes on scene?
ATIA.linkedContent: animal as tout autre, tout autre est tout autre, unreadable, undecidable, abyssal, secret > what happens to brotherhood when animal comes on scene?

ATIA.content: Derrida points out that a certain profound humanism [that of the Old Testament?] privileged the question of the animal as that of the infinitely other
ATIA.linkedContent: Derrida points out that a certain profound humanism [that of the Old Testament?] privileged the question of the animal as that of the infinitely other

ATIA.content: this silent appeal that calls from the outside, whose trace can only be disavowed w/ so many wounds, symptoms
ATIA.linkedContent: this silent appeal that calls from the outside, whose trace can only be disavowed w/ so many wounds, symptoms

O.content: literature is beyond of everything: author would have to disappear along w/ literature
O.linkedContent: literature is beyond of everything: author would have to disappear along w/ literature

O.content: literature is the exception in the whole and the exception to everything (l’exception de tout) (subtraction w/out lack), part (pièce) which exists by itself [solitude], marks le tout autre
O.linkedContent: literature is the exception in the whole and the exception to everything (l’exception de tout) (subtraction w/out lack), part (pièce) which exists by itself [solitude], marks le tout autre

SW.content: God as name of what gives the order to give the veil (btwn holy & holy of holies), veil as gift (that it is) ordered to give, gives to think separation from le tout autre (faith itself) > did this come to an end w/ death of Christ? can it be comprehended in veiled folds of Greek alētheia?
SW.linkedContent: God as name of what gives the order to give the veil (btwn holy & holy of holies), veil as gift (that it is) ordered to give, gives to think separation from le tout autre (faith itself) > did this come to an end w/ death of Christ? can it be comprehended in veiled folds of Greek alētheia?

SW.content: absolute knowledge will not accept that there will be nothing behind the curtain (in the veiled place of le tout autre: nothing that is in the present)
SW.linkedContent: absolute knowledge will not accept that there will be nothing behind the curtain (in the veiled place of le tout autre: nothing that is in the present)

DPi.content: damnum, via Benveniste, money given w/out return, given for nothing > excess of compelled expenditure pays more than is due, marks double law of homogeneity/proportionality btwn damage/punishment & their incalculable heterogeneity: the condemned/damned pays what he owes and does something tout autre, infinitely more than acquit himself of calculable debt: there is economy/aneconomy > “unless it is a matter of reimbursement (indemnification) and interest as the incalculable surplus value of capital”
DPi.linkedContent: damnum, via Benveniste, money given w/out return, given for nothing > excess of compelled expenditure pays more than is due, marks double law of homogeneity/proportionality btwn damage/punishment & their incalculable heterogeneity: the condemned/damned pays what he owes and does something tout autre, infinitely more than acquit himself of calculable debt: there is economy/aneconomy > “unless it is a matter of reimbursement (indemnification) and interest as the incalculable surplus value of capital”

REST.content: logic of detachment as cut (opposition, leads to suturing-sublation, maintains problematic of castration truth) vs. logic of detachment as stricture (is tout autre, interlacing of differance of [or as] stricture, no suture, haunting, neither empty nor full, l’argument-de-la-gaine, can’t accommodate the couple, ces coupes oppositionelles, the ghost leases, le, la, les double(s) band-)
REST.linkedContent: logic of detachment as cut (opposition, leads to suturing-sublation, maintains problematic of castration truth) vs. logic of detachment as stricture (is tout autre, interlacing of differance of [or as] stricture, no suture, haunting, neither empty nor full, l’argument-de-la-gaine, can’t accommodate the couple, ces coupes oppositionelles, the ghost leases, le, la, les double(s) band-)

PIO.content: invention of tout autre beyond possible status, still invention because one prepares to let the other come > deconstruction is that which gets ready for the coming of the other (deconstructs this double genitive) > to invent: to “know” how to say “come” and answer “come” of other
PIO.linkedContent: invention of tout autre beyond possible status, still invention because one prepares to let the other come > deconstruction is that which gets ready for the coming of the other (deconstructs this double genitive) > to invent: to “know” how to say “come” and answer “come” of other

PIO.content: sole concern of invention of the other (the coming of invention): allow adventure or event of tout autre to come > future-to-come
PIO.linkedContent: sole concern of invention of the other (the coming of invention): allow adventure or event of tout autre to come > future-to-come

PIO.content: tout autre not any figures of ontotheological configuration (subject, consciousness, unconscious, self, man or woman)
PIO.linkedContent: tout autre not any figures of ontotheological configuration (subject, consciousness, unconscious, self, man or woman)

PF.content: countersignature: confirmation of an agreement & a wholly other signature: counterforce [re: Peggy Kamuf’s collection, Derrida’s texts have returned to him transformed]
PF.linkedContent: countersignature: confirmation of an agreement & a wholly other signature: counterforce [re: Peggy Kamuf’s collection, Derrida’s texts have returned to him transformed]

TR.content: since every “I” is an “I”——tout autre est tout autre as the same: (the) I can betray w/out least appearance becoming manifest > substitution “I” for “I”: root of perjury
TR.linkedContent: since every “I” is an “I”——tout autre est tout autre as the same: (the) I can betray w/out least appearance becoming manifest > substitution “I” for “I”: root of perjury

D.content: limits of square/cube—indefinitely specular unfolding/refolding: not limits at all > opening of its own inscription—tout autre, la même, another geometry to come [EROS]
D.linkedContent: limits of square/cube—indefinitely specular unfolding/refolding: not limits at all > opening of its own inscription—tout autre, la même, another geometry to come [EROS]

HST.content: absolute hospitality: say “yes” to the coming of le tout autre, absolutely inanticipable stranger ——madness of concept of hospitality: Messiah as hôte; visitation not invitation (not dialectical opposition) > invitation prepares for visitations
HST.linkedContent: absolute hospitality: say “yes” to the coming of le tout autre, absolutely inanticipable stranger ——madness of concept of hospitality: Messiah as hôte; visitation not invitation (not dialectical opposition) > invitation prepares for visitations

TN.content: for there to be a good heart: possibility of bad heart must remain forever open, i.e. tout autre > good heart must be ready for the other, for treachery, for perjury (inevitable-impossible vow of abstinence, tactile’s fate); is this how we can translate Kant’s “evil heart”?
TN.linkedContent: for there to be a good heart: possibility of bad heart must remain forever open, i.e. tout autre > good heart must be ready for the other, for treachery, for perjury (inevitable-impossible vow of abstinence, tactile’s fate); is this how we can translate Kant’s “evil heart”?

TN.content: the “self” is as indispensable as you in se toucher toi, an “I” unable to touch itself couldn't se plier à ce qui le déplie absolument, au tout autre qui, comme tout autre, habite mon coeur en étranger > no anthropological limit here > “divine,” “animal,” & life all derivative of se toucher toi
TN.linkedContent: the “self” is as indispensable as you in se toucher toi, an “I” unable to touch itself couldn't se plier à ce qui le déplie absolument, au tout autre qui, comme tout autre, habite mon coeur en étranger > no anthropological limit here > “divine,” “animal,” & life all derivative of se toucher toi

ATM.content: how can Levinas inscribe le tout autre in language of being, of the present, w/in its syntax, lexicon, under its law? > or: cette langue n’est pas d’elle-même déliée, opens to tout autre?
ATM.linkedContent: how can Levinas inscribe le tout autre in language of being, of the present, w/in its syntax, lexicon, under its law? > or: cette langue n’est pas d’elle-même déliée, opens to tout autre?

ATM.content: doing so in a way, where the fault (la faute) [see p. 149 Derrida’s fault, failing], which consists in inscribing tout autre in empire of same, alters the same enough to absolve it of itself
ATM.linkedContent: doing so in a way, where the fault (la faute) [see p. 149 Derrida’s fault, failing], which consists in inscribing tout autre in empire of same, alters the same enough to absolve it of itself

ATM.content: the taking place in another place of Levinas’s oeuvre is an extravagant topic, another thinking of the name, a thinking that is tout autre because open to the name of the other (u-topic only for those who believe they know ce qui a lieu et ce qui tient lieu)
ATM.linkedContent: the taking place in another place of Levinas’s oeuvre is an extravagant topic, another thinking of the name, a thinking that is tout autre because open to the name of the other (u-topic only for those who believe they know ce qui a lieu et ce qui tient lieu)

ATM.content: infinite law of quotation marks suspends all reference, work enclosed in a borderless context it gives to itself (se donne à elle-même), while making absolute reference to command of tout autre
ATM.linkedContent: infinite law of quotation marks suspends all reference, work enclosed in a borderless context it gives to itself (se donne à elle-même), while making absolute reference to command of tout autre

ATM.content: Levinas appeals to a tout autre which is sexually unmarked, thus making sexual difference secondary, and yet, this unsexed alterity is referred to as HE (IL)
ATM.linkedContent: Levinas appeals to a tout autre which is sexually unmarked, thus making sexual difference secondary, and yet, this unsexed alterity is referred to as HE (IL)

ATM.content: by excluding the woman in alterity, does the woman become the tout autre of Levinas’ seriasure, weaving the text from its other side
ATM.linkedContent: by excluding the woman in alterity, does the woman become the tout autre of Levinas’ seriasure, weaving the text from its other side

AD.content: for Levinas, relate to tout autre by way of heteronymous curvature > relation to other— justice
AD.linkedContent: for Levinas, relate to tout autre by way of heteronymous curvature > relation to other— justice

AD.content: no hospitality w/out chance of spectrality; God uncontaminated by Being: rigorous definition of the Face, le tout autre > as spectral as it is spiritual? gives orders, gives pardon
AD.linkedContent: no hospitality w/out chance of spectrality; God uncontaminated by Being: rigorous definition of the Face, le tout autre > as spectral as it is spiritual? gives orders, gives pardon

WOG.content: the remainder (of all ontology) and the contamination btwn tout autre and its regular reappropriation (economic redialectization) haunts all Derrida’s essays on the Greeks
WOG.linkedContent: the remainder (of all ontology) and the contamination btwn tout autre and its regular reappropriation (economic redialectization) haunts all Derrida’s essays on the Greeks

WOG.content: the tout autre of the Greek, the figure of a tout autre unfigurable by him
WOG.linkedContent: the tout autre of the Greek, the figure of a tout autre unfigurable by him

BSi.content: Celan’s tout autre [ganz Andere] not alter-ego, not another living present, but inaccessible other
BSi.linkedContent: Celan’s tout autre [ganz Andere] not alter-ego, not another living present, but inaccessible other

BSi.content: Celan: poem speaks in the cause of the strange, “vielleicht in eines ganz Anderen Sache”
BSi.linkedContent: Celan: poem speaks in the cause of the strange, “vielleicht in eines ganz Anderen Sache”

BSi.content: tout autre can’t resemble or be introjected, assimilated into mine: chance of encounter, event, takes one’s breath sway—turns it [is tout autre sovereign or sovereignty of no sovereignty?]
BSi.linkedContent: tout autre can’t resemble or be introjected, assimilated into mine: chance of encounter, event, takes one’s breath sway—turns it [is tout autre sovereign or sovereignty of no sovereignty?]

OG.content: Derrida calls instituted trace “unmotivated” (immotivée), asks that the word “institution” not be so quickly interpreted w/in classical oppositions; “unmotivated” deconstructs Saussure’s arbitrary, thinks its possibility en-deçà de (short of) l’opposition dérivée btwn nature/convention, symbol/sign > becoming-unmotivated of trace requires synthesis where le tout autre s’annonce comme tel: not more natural than cultural
OG.linkedContent: Derrida calls instituted trace “unmotivated” (immotivée), asks that the word “institution” not be so quickly interpreted w/in classical oppositions; “unmotivated” deconstructs Saussure’s arbitrary, thinks its possibility en-deçà de (short of) l’opposition dérivée btwn nature/convention, symbol/sign > becoming-unmotivated of trace requires synthesis where le tout autre s’annonce comme tel: not more natural than cultural

OG.content: death, violence, impossibility of pure point, “point vocative,” death of absolutely proper naming (the other as pure other) is death of pure idiom
OG.linkedContent: death, violence, impossibility of pure point, “point vocative,” death of absolutely proper naming (the other as pure other) is death of pure idiom

SPEC.content: Freud repeats his arrest, pas de marche: speculative possibility of tout autre (than PP), inscribed in advance w/in it, “l’ouvre d’une scription de l’autre à meme (overlaps) le principe”
SPEC.linkedContent: Freud repeats his arrest, pas de marche: speculative possibility of tout autre (than PP), inscribed in advance w/in it, “l’ouvre d’une scription de l’autre à meme (overlaps) le principe”

SPEC.content: la surface même du “à même (overlap)” does not belong to itself—writing affects the very surface of its support > non-belonging unleashes speculation
SPEC.linkedContent: la surface même du “à même (overlap)” does not belong to itself—writing affects the very surface of its support > non-belonging unleashes speculation

SPEC.content: PP always revient to itself, haunted by tout autre, retour never “acquits” speculation of PP
SPEC.linkedContent: PP always revient to itself, haunted by tout autre, retour never “acquits” speculation of PP

SPEC.content: death drive, w/out contradicting PP, hollows it out, older, not an other mastery (Herrschaft), but other than master, tout autre (not dialectically opposed to PP as life, living, alive)
SPEC.linkedContent: death drive, w/out contradicting PP, hollows it out, older, not an other mastery (Herrschaft), but other than master, tout autre (not dialectically opposed to PP as life, living, alive)

SPEC.content: Freud’s auto-affective structure of time, life as the auto-affection of death, differance lodged in desire (desire nothing but this) for this auto-tely: auto-delegates & arrives only by differing in tout autre [for Freud, life-death announced to serve the proper, an economy of death]
SPEC.linkedContent: Freud’s auto-affective structure of time, life as the auto-affection of death, differance lodged in desire (desire nothing but this) for this auto-tely: auto-delegates & arrives only by differing in tout autre [for Freud, life-death announced to serve the proper, an economy of death]
